definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
"cover" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 14), occurring in 軍|军[jun1], 冠[guan1] etc, known as 禿寶蓋|秃宝盖[tu1 bao3 gai4] or 平寶蓋|平宝盖[ping2 bao3 gai4]

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
Tian Liang (1979-), former male Chinese diver, Olympic medalist

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind

sentences.english: Clean and bright, You look happy to meet me.
sentences.chinese: 小而白，洁又亮，见到我你面露喜色。

sentences.english: Red and bright, hanging in the sky.
He showed his identity card and went in.
sentences.chinese: 他把工作证亮了一下就进去了。

sentences.english: A solitary candle light ened the darkness of the room.
sentences.chinese: 一支孤烛使黑暗的房间亮了起来。

sentences.english: On the table beside me burned a lamp, and near it lay a little box.
sentences.chinese: 我身边的桌上亮着一盏灯，灯旁放着一个小箱。

sentences.english: Gradually, the sky lit up, sea, and days have become clear when.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地，天空亮了起来，海和天也变得分明了。

sentences.english: He turned, his eyes huge and bright even in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 他转过身来，在昏暗中也能看出他的眼睛又大又亮。

sentences.english: There is a small dot, brighter than its surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 那里有个小点，要比周围亮一些的。

sentences.english: Tian An Men Square looks even more beautiful with all lights on.
sentences.chinese: 所有的灯都亮着，天安门广场显得更加漂亮。

sentences.english: With a cell and a wire, can you make two bulbs light up?
sentences.chinese: 仅用一根导线和一节电池能让两个小灯泡亮起来吗？

sentences.english: The stone head of the Buddha is polished because many people rub it as they go past.
sentences.chinese: 路过游客不断的抚摸使这个石佛的头部显得亮锃锃的。

sentences.english: This was his summing up the spirit of the Liang Jian.
sentences.chinese: 这也是他总结的亮剑精神所在。

sentences.english: Her big eyes suddenly lighted up when she saw them.
sentences.chinese: 她见到他们时，一双大眼睛突然亮了起来。

sentences.english: An excellent medium pale sstaw colour with lemon green tints .
sentences.chinese: 酒色带有一种极好的中度亮黄色带有柠檬绿的光晕。

sentences.english: The places you have visited are marked in bright purple on the map of the world .
sentences.chinese: 你去过的地方将会在世界地图上用亮紫色标出来。

sentences.english: The sky started to grow lighter and the shadow in the little town less dark.
sentences.chinese: 天色渐渐发白，小镇里的阴影处也慢慢亮了起来。

definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
light/beam of light/gleam of light/light reflected from an object

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
